input_text:
Job Title: Manager, Analytics & Insights

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Phreesia is looking for an Analytics & Insights Manager to join our growing Life Sciences Team. The Analytics & Insights (AI) Manager will utilize various types of data to draw insights and build strategic recommendations to advance Phreesia’s patient communications business in life sciences and healthcare. This is a strategic, client-facing role that involves communication and collaboration with agency and brand partners.

This position works collaboratively with internal teams (including but not limited to the sales team, data science team, clinical team, and content strategy team) to identify and optimize digital patient engagement campaigns, effectively communicating the value of Phreesia and ensuring validation of campaign success.

The Analytics & Insights Manager will own inventory forecasting, campaign management, measurement and reporting for several disease areas encompassing numerous client campaigns within each area.

The Manager, Analytics & Insights will also support strategic initiatives aimed at optimizing processes, identifying novel data use cases, supporting new market development initiatives, and bringing new innovations to life in partnership with data science, product, and other teams throughout Phreesia.

What You'll Do

Function in a consultative manner, efficiently translating data and insights into strategic solutions for internal and client teamsServe as an analytics/insights expert on assigned accounts to help pull through brand goals and strategic imperativesProvide strategic support around inventory management, prioritization and targeting recommendations to support sales and executional teamsSupport the sales team to demonstrate the value of Phreesia through robust measurementto potential clients and successfully communicate campaign details and measurementManage and present campaign reporting and measurement, generating insights and client-facing stories from both primary and secondary dataWork closely across the data science team to analyze data and cull insightsWork cross-functionally on strategic projects, thought leadership, sales support materials, ad hoc requests, and other measurement collateral using 3rd party data, internal data, and secondary research. This may include market landscape insights, point of care insights, media insights and comparison data, ROI analyses, case studies, benchmarking and moreSupport new initiatives in partnership with Analytics & Insights team leaders to develop new approaches to data assessment and drive meaningful business growth and operational efficienciesContributes individually, as well as builds relationships with internal team members, including mentorship of junior team members

What You'll Bring

Bachelor's Degree requiredAt least 4 years of experience in healthcare, or a related field. Pharma/healthcare experience is required.Consultative experience with clientsOutstanding problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to think strategically, knowing how to utilize data to guide bigger picture decisionsHigh energy self-starter who enjoys finding creative solutions to complex problemsComfortable with ambiguity, possessing intellectual curiosity to dig into data able to find the underlying cause of a problemTeam player that is comfortable going against the grain and backing up opinion with dataPassion, with a drive to improve and growHighly organized with strong attention to detail

Base pay for US is $105,000 - $115,000 USD depending on qualifications.

Who We Are

At Phreesia, we’re looking for smart and passionate people to help drive our mission of creating a better, more engaging healthcare experience. We’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in an ever-evolving landscape by transforming the way healthcare is delivered. Our SaaS platform digitizes appointment check-in and offers tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing, and enhance clinical care.

Phreesia cares about our employees by providing a diverse and dynamic work environment. We’re a five-time winner of Modern Healthcare Magazine’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare award and we’ve been recognized on the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index. We are dedicated to continuously improving our employee experience by launching new programs and initiatives. If you thrive in a culture of recognition, value inclusivity, professional development, and growth opportunities, Phreesia could be a great fit!

Top-rated Employee Benefits

100% Remote work + home office expense reimbursementsCompetitive compensationFlexible PTO + 8 company holidaysMonthly reimbursement for cell phone + internet + wellness100% Paid 12-week parental leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous parental benefit to our employees in CanadaVariety of insurance coverage for people (and pets!)Continuing education and professional certification reimbursementOpportunity to join an Employee Resource Group. Learn more here: https://www.phreesia.com/dei/

We strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
